page.title: 18Local history around Langho
page.content: Early farming communities , Dinckedelay and Langdals existed in the 14th century . The valley remained unchaged until the Preston-Skipton Road was turnpiked in 1800. The Blackburn - Hellifield railway was engineered in the 1840's . A new Langho developed by the station , Spring Mill along Whalley New Road with cotton workers' terraced houses . There was quarring activity in moorside stone delphs along Whalley Old Road with cottages at " New " York near the Lord Nelson . Oldest buildings in the area are Carr Hall (Tudor) , Lower and Higher Woodcote ( 17th C ) , Mitton Fold ( Dr. Chew's lunatic asylum 18th C ) , Railway Hotel , Petre Arms on Whalley New Road , Lord Nelson at York.
